titleStmt.title: The pearle of practise, or Practisers pearle, for phisicke and chirurgerie. Found out by I. H. (a spagericke or distiller) amongst the learned obseruations and prooued practises of many expert men in both faculties. Since his death it is garnished and brought into some methode by a welwiller of his
titleStmt.author: Hester, John, d. 1593.
Fourestier, James.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Richard Field, dwelling in the Black-friers,

notesStmt.note: Pages 64-67 missing in number only; text unaffected.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
